title: [Large-scale] Mathematics Instructional Design Strategies for Transitioning to Online Education

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary mathematics education experience and basic digital tool proficiency
context.additional_context: Instructional design tailored for transitioning existing in-person classes to a blended (online-face-to-face) format for current professionals.

learning_goals: Learners can explain effective methods for designing mathematics concept explanations and problem-solving activities in blended environments.
Learners can apply at least three strategies for operating mathematics classes using digital tools (Zoom, LMS, real-time collaboration tools).
Learners can establish a system for assessing participation and providing feedback in hybrid classes.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
